starts.title: Both players choose a mild spice/sauce to taste
Both taste a random food from the fridge

examples.title: Both players pretend to be food critics of plain crackers
examples.extra: Give each other a star rating and a snobby quote

examples.title: Both players invent the worst dish name you can
examples.extra: Add one cursed ingredient

examples.title: Both players create a menu of cursed dishes
examples.extra: Give each a chef‑y description

examples.title: Both players taste a harmless sauce (safe item you both approve)
examples.extra: Add a mystery safe ingredient chosen by the other

examples.title: Current player invents a fake recipe step‑by‑step; the other mimes following it
examples.extra: Swap roles

examples.title: Both players feed each other one safe tiny bite at the same time
examples.extra: Hold eye contact for a slow count of 3

examples.title: Both players describe the smell of a safe kitchen item (e.g., cinnamon)
examples.extra: Guess each other's pick

examples.title: Both players do a blindfold smell test (safe items only)
examples.extra: If wrong, guess once more

examples.title: Current player mixes two harmless sauces for the other to taste
examples.extra: Rate it 1–5 'would not eat'

examples.title: Both players build a tiny food tower (safe items)
examples.extra: Balance it for 5 seconds before collapsing it

examples.title: Both players pretend to host a cursed cooking show
examples.extra: Name your signature 'inedible' dish dramatically

examples.title: Current player designs a 'mystery spice rub' (pretend only) on the other's palm
examples.extra: Smell and announce its 'notes'

examples.title: Both players create a 'restaurant review' of each other's snack plating
examples.extra: Include a 'chef hug'

examples.title: Both players taste a tiny dab of a safe hot sauce (if willing)
examples.extra: Describe the flavor like a sommelier

examples.title: Both players exchange a safe, tiny bite you each choose
examples.extra: Add one dramatic tasting note

examples.title: Current player invents a cursed smoothie (pretend) and 'serves' it to the other
examples.extra: Swap and make it worse

examples.title: Both players perform a 5‑second chef's table critique
examples.extra: Repeat with harsher 'professional' voices

examples.title: Both players try a safe blindfolded taste of something you agree on
examples.extra: Describe texture with one wild metaphor

examples.title: Current player names three ingredients; the other creates a dish title
examples.extra: Swap roles with even stranger ingredients

examples.title: Both players compare two safe sips (e.g., water vs. seltzer)
examples.extra: Declare a winner and toast

examples.title: Both players pretend to feed each other 'invisible soup'
examples.extra: React with exaggerated delight and disgust alternately

examples.title: Current player 'plates' a snack for the other with fancy gestures
examples.extra: Swap and add a ridiculous garnish

examples.title: Both players do a synchronized 'chef nod' after tasting something safe
examples.extra: Then do a synchronized 'nope' face

examples.title: Both players narrate each other's chewing like sports commentators (safe snack)
examples.extra: Switch roles mid‑bite

examples.title: Current player chooses a safe spice; the other guesses with eyes closed
examples.extra: Give a second clue and guess again

examples.title: Both players compose a haiku about a terrible imaginary dish
examples.extra: Perform it with dramatic hand flourishes

examples.title: Both players do a blindfolded safe sip challenge
examples.extra: Lean closer and whisper tasting notes

examples.title: Both players swap safe snacks and rate each other's pick
examples.extra: Re‑rate after one more tiny bite

examples.title: Both players pretend to share a gourmet mystery bite from a fork (no stabbing, safe item)
examples.extra: Hold the pose nose‑to‑nose for 3 seconds

examples.title: Both players present mock awards for the worst dish name you created tonight
examples.extra: End with a dramatic acceptance bow together
